docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Create a project
docs.text:
To create a BlueGrid project users need to click "Create" button, navigate to the directory where the project will reside and set the project name.

Image caption

Image caption

docs.title: Import/export pdf files
docs.text:
In BlueGrid users can import pdf files, append pdf pages to a pdf file, delete pdf pages or export pdf pages with quantity remarks.

via GIPHY

Image caption

docs.title: Materials
docs.text:
In BlueGrid users can define materials with code, description, type and styles. A material must be one of 4 types: Count, Linear, Area, and Volume.

  1. Add a material

via GIPHY

Image caption
  1. Edit a material

via GIPHY

Image caption
  1. Remove a material

via GIPHY

Image caption

docs.title: Open a project
docs.text:
To open a project users have 2 options: 1. Click open and navigate to the project file. 2. If the project is presented in the project list, double click to project item in the list.

Image caption

Image caption

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Write an overview of what BlueGrid standard edition can do, with support of grid images of functionalities.

via GIPHY

Image caption

via GIPHY

Image caption
